{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "7e37c7ce",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Construct map from density\n",
    "\n",
    "One way to construct a transport map is from an unnormalized density. "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "b4656c71",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "First, import MParT and other packages used in this notebook. Note that it is possible to specify the number of threads used by MParT by setting the `KOKKOS_NUM_THREADS` environment variable before importing MParT."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "4c1a1bb5",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:07.995431Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:07.994943Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.913587Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.912869Z"
    },
    "lines_to_next_cell": 0
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Kokkos is using 2 threads\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import math\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "from scipy.optimize import minimize\n",
    "from scipy.stats import norm\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "import mpart as mt\n",
    "\n",
    "print('Kokkos is using', mt.Concurrency(), 'threads')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "a0d7682b",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The target distribution is given by $x\\sim\\mathcal{N}(2, 0.5)$."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "3e649068",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.917291Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.916746Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.921561Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.920966Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "num_points = 5000\n",
    "mu = 2\n",
    "sigma = .5\n",
    "x = np.random.randn(num_points)[None,:]"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "d39e028e",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "As the reference density we choose the standard normal. "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "be6da2dc",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.924476Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.924253Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.929939Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.929278Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "reference_density = norm(loc=mu,scale=sigma)\n",
    "t = np.linspace(-3,6,100)\n",
    "rho_t = reference_density.pdf(t)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "id": "1c58f2b0",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.946201Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:08.945460Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.116647Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.115943Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "plt.figure()\n",
    "plt.hist(x.flatten(), bins=\"auto\", facecolor='blue', alpha=0.5, density=True, label='Reference samples')\n",
    "plt.plot(t, rho_t,label=\"Target density\")\n",
    "plt.yticks([])\n",
    "plt.legend()\n",
    "plt.title(\"Before optimization\")\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "bff72934",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Next we create a multi-index set and create a map. Affine transform should be enough to capture the Gaussian target."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "3967296e",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.120569Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.120113Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.124954Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.124372Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "multis = np.array([[0], [1]])  # \n",
    "mset = mt.MultiIndexSet(multis)\n",
    "fixed_mset = mset.fix(True)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "0b199df7",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now we set the map options (default in this case) and initialize the map"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "id": "aa4c7232",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.128316Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.127979Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.133786Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.133208Z"
    },
    "lines_to_next_cell": 1
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "opts = mt.MapOptions()\n",
    "monotoneMap = mt.CreateComponent(fixed_mset, opts)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "2bfe5f82",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Next we optimize the coefficients of the map by minimizing the Kullback–Leibler divergence between the target and reference density."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "id": "5f421cd4",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.138382Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.137097Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.143020Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.142459Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def objective(coeffs, monotoneMap, x, rv):\n",
    "    num_points = x.shape[0]\n",
    "    monotoneMap.SetCoeffs(coeffs)\n",
    "    map_of_x = monotoneMap.Evaluate(x)\n",
    "    pi_of_map_of_x = rv.logpdf(map_of_x)\n",
    "    log_det = monotoneMap.LogDeterminant(x)\n",
    "    return -np.sum(pi_of_map_of_x + log_det)/num_points\n",
    "\n",
    "def obj(coeffs, transport_map, x):\n",
    "    transport_map.SetCoeffs(coeffs)\n",
    "    map_of_x = transport_map.Evaluate(x)\n",
    "    logpdf= target_logpdf(map_of_x)\n",
    "    log_det = transport_map.LogDeterminant(x)\n",
    "    return -np.sum(logpdf + log_det)/num_points"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "id": "6fe90f85",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.146057Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.145733Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.361355Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.360700Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Starting coeffs\n",
      "[0. 0.]\n",
      "and error: 4.73E+04\n",
      "Final coeffs\n",
      "[ 1.99180992 -0.43135909]\n",
      "and error: 7.09E+03\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "print('Starting coeffs')\n",
    "print(monotoneMap.CoeffMap())\n",
    "print('and error: {:.2E}'.format(objective(monotoneMap.CoeffMap(), monotoneMap, x, reference_density)))\n",
    "res = minimize(objective, monotoneMap.CoeffMap(), args=(monotoneMap, x, reference_density), method=\"Nelder-Mead\")\n",
    "print('Final coeffs')\n",
    "print(monotoneMap.CoeffMap())\n",
    "print('and error: {:.2E}'.format(objective(monotoneMap.CoeffMap(), monotoneMap, x, reference_density)))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "609c2fce",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "...and plot the results. "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "61d9337c",
   "metadata": {
    "execution": {
     "iopub.execute_input": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.365222Z",
     "iopub.status.busy": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.364693Z",
     "iopub.status.idle": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.665510Z",
     "shell.execute_reply": "2022-08-26T19:29:09.664921Z"
    }
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "map_of_x = monotoneMap.Evaluate(x)\n",
    "fig, axs = plt.subplots(2,1)\n",
    "axs[0].hist(x.flatten(), bins=\"auto\", alpha=0.5, density=True, label='Reference samples')\n",
    "axs[0].hist(map_of_x.flatten(), bins=\"auto\", facecolor='blue', alpha=0.5, density=True, label='Mapped samples')\n",
    "axs[0].plot(t,rho_t,label=\"Target density\")\n",
    "axs[0].legend()\n",
    "axs[0].set_yticks([])\n",
    "\n",
    "axs[1].hist(x.flatten(), bins=\"auto\", density=True, label='Reference samples', cumulative=True, histtype='step')\n",
    "axs[1].hist(map_of_x.flatten(), bins=\"auto\", density=True, label='Mapped samples', cumulative=True, histtype='step')\n",
    "axs[1].plot(t, reference_density.cdf(t), label='Target density')\n",
    "axs[1].legend()\n",
    "axs[1].set_yticks([])\n",
    "\n",
    "fig.suptitle(\"After optimization\")\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  }
 ],
